  Hi Di=
rk, still having a bit of trouble with some of these kanji but it 
  looks =
to me like

  Pic1 - Right side, Izumi no Kami
  Pic 1 - Left side - Koike =
Yoshiro
  Pc 2 - Naomasa

  So, that would make it Yoshiro Zogan if Shoshin=
 and probably late 
  Muromachi, early Edo.

  Izumi no Kami Koike Yoshiro
=
  Naomasa

  Look to Nihonto Koza Kodogu page 19-21

  Rich

  >   >   Dirk, on your scanner, try =
propping up one end of the tsuba off the
  >   >   glass, bu about 1/4 to 1=
/2 inch, then scan the mei area. The angle
  >   > helps
  >   >   reflect =
light of the chisel strokes and can make the mei easier to
  >   > read.
  =
>   >   Try lifting both ends fo rdifferent results.
  >   >
